title: Savoring the future
description: Parents often make future plans for and with their children. Then they have constructed scenes in their mind of things they look forward to.  This process is designed to savor the future without these scenes happening, and more coming to terms with the future that will not be.

steps.title: Intro
steps.description:
Parents often make future plans for and with their children. Then they have constructed scenes in their mind of things they look forward to.

This process is designed to savor the future without these scenes happening, and more coming to terms with the future that will not be.
steps.notes: Most parents found tremendous value and relief following this process

steps.title: Eliciting future loss response
steps.description: Think about the things you will never get to do or explore with {hchildName}, or thoughts about dreams and hopes you had for {hchildHim} that will not happen now.

answers.text: OK, got a few in mind
I had so many things planned, this still hurts ...

steps.title: Eliciting future loss response - Choosing one
steps.description:
${echo}

From those future scenarios, pick the one that still bothers you or hurts you the most to think about now.

answers.text: Not sure if this is the strongest one, but I got one

steps.title: Eliciting future loss response - Description
steps.description: As you think about that, describe to me a bit what image comes to mind
steps.notes: No need for details, a title for reference would do. I.e. “taking {hchildHim} to college”

steps.title: The cue
steps.description:
${echo}

OK, we’ll call that the “cue”. Now you can put that cue experience aside for now, we’ll use it soon.

answers.text: I’ve set it aside, what’s next?

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Savored dream
steps.description:
Now let me ask you something.

In all your life on this odd planet, I'm sure you had many things planned, many dreams, some more meaningful than others.

answers.text: Some more meaningful than others, indeed

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Savored dream
steps.description:
${echo}

Now, many of those have not happened, correct?

answers.text: I have some that didn't, but most came true

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Savored dream - Description
steps.notes: No need for details, just title and age for reference will do, i.e. “Play professional basketball, age 21”

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Validation
steps.description:
OK, we’ll call this the “resource”. And as you think about this resource now:

${echo}

You can remember wanting it to happen, but you are ok with it not happening yes?

It might have been nice to have happened, but you can still savor it, appreciate it, and are at peace with it not happening yes?
steps.notes: (i.e. you have come to terms with knowing and acknowledging that)

answers.text: I used to want it, but it’s still savored
I feel bad about it not happening

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Choosing another
steps.description:
${echo}

OK, so I’m redirecting you back to the previous step, to pick another life dream or plan that didn’t happen, but is still savored
steps.notes: Something you enjoy thinking about, and you’ve  come to terms about it not happening

answers.text: Ok, let me pick another resource

steps.title: Eliciting resource - Image
steps.description:
***"${s8}"***

Good, and as you keep thinking about this now:

*${s7}*

Allow an image to come to mind

steps.title: Congruence check (CC)
steps.description: Do you have any objections to experience the future scenarios regarding {hchildName}, in the same way you are experiencing that savored dream that didn't happen?

answers.text: No, I'd love to savor that future

steps.title: Common questions & concerns
steps.description:
***"Yes, I have an objection"***

I'm glad you are being honest with me and yourself. As I said in the beginning, we'll only do what you are comfortable doing.

Please go over the following FAQs, and let me know which ones were relevant for you, and if you still have an objection.
steps.notes:
***- "My heart don't want to let it go"***  
I certainly don't want you to let it go, either. we are not abolishing or erasing {hchildName}, and everything we do is reversible, so no need to let it go. Just like the dream you used to have, but didn't happen, I am offering you a way to honor that future plan you had with/for {hchildHim}, in a more peaceful and loving way.

***- "Isn't grieving about this a way to honor it?"***  
Indeed, it's honoring it by marking how much it is important for you. Otherwise, there would be nothing to grieve about. What I am offering you is a way to honor it even more, by remembering it in a softer, peaceful way, so you can treasure it and appreciate it while feeling more complete; honoring it in a more “wholesome” way. To savor and cherish it forever. 

if you still have a concern or a question, mark "I still have an objection/question".

if there's something you want to comment before proceeding, click "other" and write it there.

answers.text: That's a lovely way to describe it
I'm ready to continue, thank you for clarifying

steps.title: Contrastive analysis
steps.description:
Now as you think about both of these at the same time:

**The resource:**  
*"${s7}"*

**And the cue:**  
*"${s3}"*

Attend to the differences in how you see, hear, and experience them in your mind.

As you go back and forth between the two a few times, notice the visual, auditory, and tactile differences between the way you experience them.

What are the main differences you see, hear, and feel between the two? Write down all differences you can already notice.
steps.inputPlaceholder: The differences I already notice are ...

steps.title: Contrastive analysis - Location & distance
steps.description:
Now check, as you look at the resource image and the cue image, are the images in the same place in your physical space?

For example you might see one image further away to your left, while the the other will be closer and to your right.

answers.text: One image is closer than the other
One image is higher than the other
One image is more to my right and the other to my left
One image is more in front of me than the other
The images are in the exact same place

steps.title: Contrastive analysis - Location & distance
steps.description:
***“The images are in the exact same place”***

While it does happen that the images are in the same place and distance to begin with, it is very rare, so I just want to be thorough here, with your permission.

I want you to look again at the **resource image** again:  
*${s7}*

Then at the **cue image** again:  
*${s3}*

And go back and forth between the two a few times. Then close your eyes and point at the location you see each of them.

Are you pointing to the **exact same place**, and the images are the **exact same distance** from you?

answers.text: I’m pointing to the exact same place
I’m pointing to two different places

steps.title: Mapping across - Location & distance
steps.description:
Now notice what happens as you allow the cue image, to slide to the same location of the resource image.

So you see both images in the same location and distance from you.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping across - Brightness / dimness
steps.description:
Next notice what happens as you allow the cue image to become as bright (or as dim) as the resource image.

So you see both images in the same brightness/dimness.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping across - Depth(3d)
steps.description:
Now notice what happens as you allow the cue image to become as deep/flat as the resource image.

So you see both images in the same depth.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping across - Vividness & focus
steps.description:
Next notice what happens as you allow the cue image to become as vivid and focused as the resource image.

So you see both images in the same vividness & focus.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping across - Sound
steps.description:
Do any of the images have sound?

Voice, background noises, music, or any type of sound.

steps.title: Mapping across - Sound
steps.description:
***“Both have sound”***

Notice what happens as you allow the sound of the cue image, to become like the sound of the resource image.

So you hear both of them in the same way. Same sound quality, tempo, tone, volume, direction, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping across - Sound
steps.description:
***“Cue does, resource doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you allow the cue image to become muted as well.

Like in a tv remote, as you press the “mute” button, or the “decrease volume” all the way to zero.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping across - Sound
steps.description:
***“Resource has, cue doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you turn on the sound in the cue image, and allow it to become like the sound of the resource image.

Like in a tv remote, as you press the “mute/unmute” button, or the “increase volume” all the way to zero. So you hear both of them in the same way. Same sound quality, tempo, tone, direction, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping across - Tactile / touch
steps.description:
Do any of the images have tactile sensations or a sense of touch?

I.e. you feel someone’s touch, something touching your skin, etc

steps.title: Mapping across - Tactile / touch
steps.description:
***“Both have tactile”***

Notice what happens as you allow the tactile sensations of the cue image, to become like the tactile sensations of the resource image.

So you feel the touch in both of them in the same way. Same texture, temperature, softness/stiffness, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping across - Tactile / touch
steps.description:
***“Cue does, resource doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you allow the tactile sensation of the cue image to drain away, and become touchless/tactiless as well.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping across - Tactile / touch
steps.description:
***“Resource has, cue doesn't”***

Notice what happens as you start feeling the sense of touch in the cue image, and allow it to become like the sense of touch in the resource image.

So you feel the touch in both of them in the same way. Same texture, temperature, softness/stiffness, etc

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Mapping across - Remaining differences
steps.description:
Now go back and forth between both images and scan for remaining differences.

Is there anything else in the way you experience the resource, which you'd like to apply to the cue?

**Resource:**
*"${s7}"*

**Cue:**
*"${s3}"*

answers.text: I don't notice any remaining differences
I notice some differences I want to apply
I notice some differences I don't want to apply

steps.title: Mapping across - Remaining differences
steps.description:
***“I noticed some differences I want to apply”***

Good observation, what remaining differences do you notice?

steps.title: Mapping across - Remaining differences
steps.description:
${echo}

Apply them as well now and notice what happens

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - color
steps.description:
As you think of this experience you just transformed now:

*"${s3}"*

Try making it B&W/gray scale, and decrease the colorfulness

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Fading out
steps.description:
Now try fading it out a bit, and notice how much increases the peace.

Allow it to fade out completely, then start fading it in, so you find your sweet spot.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Transparency
steps.description: Now allow it to fade out a bit, and notice how much it increases the peace.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Zoom out
steps.description: Next try “zooming out” the experience. The image itself would still be at the same plane, and the same distance from you, but the content of the image would zoom out.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.notes: It sometimes helps to think of a camera or taking a photo with your smartphone. You can zoom out the camera, so the screen is still in the same distance from you, but the image on the screen is zoomed out.

steps.title: Increasing peace - Distance
steps.description:
Next allow it to get further into the distance, to a point you still see it but much less, and notice how much it increases the peace.

Allow it to get waaaaaay far into the distance, then start pulling it back a bit closer, so you find your sweet spot.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Still & flat
steps.description: If it's not already a still flat image, make it still and flat, and notice how much it increases the peace.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Frame
steps.description:
Now how about putting a frame around that pic?

Try different frames, see if anything works for you.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Lamination & glass
steps.description: Next experiment with different lamination and glass over the image, and notice how much it increases the peace.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Muting
steps.description: If there's sound or voices that goes with the image, try muting it and notice if you prefer it that way

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Tactile
steps.description: If there's a sense of touch to the image, or any other tactile sensation, remove it and notice if you prefer it that way

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Word, date, album
steps.description:
Now some parents found it appropriate to add a word(s) to the image, or a date. It could be on the image itself somewhere, above it, to the side or below.

Some parents also like to put the image in a photo album in their mind.

The words can be written in an artistic way, with decorations (gold is common). If this doesn't make sense to you or doesn't appeal to you, skip it. If you are not sure, the best way to find out is to experiment.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Increasing peace - Additional changes
steps.description:
Now take a moment to play the “director” role, notice if there are any further changes you'd like to make. Something you'd like to add or embellish in anyway.

We can always revise this later of course, and there's no "right or wrong" here.

answers.text: Nothing comes to mind at the moment
Hmm … There’s something I want to try

steps.title: Increasing peace - Additional changes
Increasing peace - Additional changes
steps.description:
${echo}

Now notice what happens as you allow that change to take place now.

answers.text: I don’t feel a change in this step

steps.title: Generalizing peace - Intro
steps.description:
When we started, I asked you to think about the future plans & dreams you had with and for ${hchildName}.

Then we picked the strongest one, and we transformed it.

Now it's time to generalize the change, and savor the rest of them.

steps.title: Generalizing peace - Check

answers.text: The other experiences are not yet there
The other experiences are already there

steps.title: Generalizing peace
steps.notes:
**Note**: Some parents prefer to repeat the individual process with another single experience first, before generalizing the change to the rest of them.

If that's the case for you, click "let's transform another single experience first"

answers.text: All the other changes have taken place
let's transform another single experience first

steps.title: Choosing next single experience
steps.description:
***"let's transform another single experience first"***

OK, so I'm redirecting you back to the first step, so you could choose the next single experience to transform.

It's usually much faster, easier, and more automatic the second time.

answers.text: OK, let's transform another single experience
Actually, let me try generalizing the change again

steps.title: Congruence check (CC)
steps.description:
***"All the other changes have taken place"***

Great, and do you have any objections being this way, experiencing these experiences like that, savoring and cherishing the future plans you had for your child?

answers.text: I'd LOVE to be this way and cherish this forever
